meanings.sent1: She grasped the rope tightly to climb the tree.
meanings.sent2: He quickly grasped the opportunity to showcase his talent.
meanings.sent3: The little girl grasped her teddy bear tightly before falling asleep.
meanings.sent4: The concept of time is like trying to grasp water in your hands.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure grasped her heart with icy fingers.

meanings.sent1: After studying hard, she finally grasped the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent2: He grasped the main idea of the story after reading it twice.
meanings.sent3: The student grasped the concept of gravity by imagining a flying elephant.
meanings.sent4: The truth of the situation slowly grasped her like a creeping shadow.
meanings.sent5: The importance of kindness can be grasped by observing small acts of generosity.

meanings.definition: To grip or clutch with the hand or hands
meanings.sent1: The child grasped the handle of the door and pulled it open.
meanings.sent2: She grasped the edge of the table to steady herself.
meanings.sent3: The monkey grasped the banana and happily ate it.
meanings.sent4: His words grasped her attention like a strong hand on her shoulder.
meanings.sent5: The wind grasped the leaves and scattered them across the yard.
